description: Iraq invades Kuwait, triggering the Gulf War and major supply disruptions
Asian financial crisis begins, reducing oil demand from emerging economies
OPEC agrees to cut production by 2.1 million barrels per day
Terrorist attacks on US lead to economic uncertainty and demand concerns
US-led invasion of Iraq creates supply uncertainty in major producing region
Oil prices reach all-time high of $147 before collapsing due to global recession
Financial system crisis leads to massive demand destruction and price collapse
Libyan civil war begins, removing 1.6 million barrels per day from market
Islamic State captures key Iraqi city, threatening oil infrastructure
OPEC decides not to cut production despite oversupply, triggering price war
Iran nuclear deal reached, anticipating return of Iranian oil exports
OPEC+ agrees to cut production by 1.2 million barrels per day
US withdraws from Iran nuclear deal and reimposes sanctions
Saudi-Russia price war begins after failed OPEC+ negotiations
WHO declares COVID-19 a pandemic, global lockdowns devastate oil demand
WTI crude futures go negative for the first time in history
Russia invades Ukraine, triggering major sanctions and supply disruptions
EU agrees to ban 90% of Russian oil imports by year end
